content: XXXhttp://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2009-05-04-new-homeless_N.htm?loc=interstitialskipXXX PINELLAS COUNTY, Fla. — Jim Marshall recalls everything about that beautiful fall day. The temperature was about 70 degrees on Nov. 19, the sky was "totally blue," and the laughter from a martini bar drifted into the St. Petersburg park where Marshall, 39, sat contemplating his first day of homelessness "I was thinking, 'That was me at one point,' " he says of the revelers. "Now I'm thinking, 'Where am I going to sleep tonight? Where do I eat? Where do I shower?' " Tent cities and shelters from California to Massachusetts report growing demand from the newly homeless. The National Alliance to End Homelessness predicted in January that the recession would force 1.5 million more people into homelessness over the next two years. Already, "tens of thousands" have lost their homes, Alliance President Nan Roman says. [IMG] USA TODAY is a Main Stream Media Outlet, so your thoughts? Is this Hysteria, or the shape of things to come under 0bams watch?
reply: XXXhttp://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2009-05-04-new-homeless_N.htm?loc=interstitialskipXXX PINELLAS COUNTY, Fla. — Jim Marshall recalls everything about that beautiful fall day. content: quote: quote: Is this Hysteria, or the shape of things to come under 0bams watch? quote: Is this Hysteria, or the shape of things to come under 0bams watch? Who knows. Wait and see. News from the front: My first quarter sales are down a little over a third.. ..but wait, Obama's plan may be working. My April sales are only off by 26% (sic). I am a sole proprietor who works alone, and by choice, don't make much. This year, apparently no savings and no new wood purchases. However, i have laid in a 5 year supply of chordwood for heating and, in the least a 5 year supply of redwood for my business of making signs. 'NO NEW TAXES...' Bull. Who's going to pay for all of this, of us, the crap we chose by being asleep at the wheel? Someday soon, perhaps, i'll be dunned in a carbon tax. Keep a close eye on your census taker. Who does he or she work for?

content: Ya know... Obama is about as responsible for this debacle as Hoover was. They both inherited the problem. it is amazing how much crap is spread by those who know the LEAST. "It sounds good, so it must be true" and like a good mouth piece, the lie is spread onto the ears of OTHER ignorant people. the lack of oversight, and the almighty competition and the "capitalist way" fed this dragon. Competition works best if there is a referee, or an umpire, or some sort of controlling authority. Without the refs, football matches would get out of hand (especially when so much money is involved) so why can there not be some controlling authority that can say "foul" i mean, there is the FCC for trading stock. but when is "too much", well, too much? Hamilton’s Lasaize farez worked back then and only for a short time. Today, the Government BELONGS to the big businessmen. They have the bucks to move and shake policy while we sit here and blame the presidents for their INDIVIDUAL lack of power. This message has been edited. Last edited by: Elesso, Thu 14 May 2009 11:26 AM

content: While I agree with you Elesso that Mr. Obama was not responsible for the initial recession, he can be held accountable for the actions he and the Democrat controlled Congress have taken that are sure to turn a big problem into a catastrophe. He will be held accountable for increasing the deficit by obscene amounts that our grand children will still be paying into their retirement. He will be blamed for rushing this nation at breakneck speed into socialism by relieving people of what vestiges of personal responsibility remain and for the grand redistribution of wealth program he is implementing. People whine about outsourcing now; just wait until productive people get tired of carrying those who are not and leave the country for greener pastures or just decide wealth is not worth it since it is going to be seized anyway. There will be fewer and fewer "rich" people to support more and more underachievers. Coupled with socialized medicine, weakening our intelligence community and military, reduced individual and state rights and consolidation of power in the Federal Government these actions by Mr. Obama, Nancy Pelosi and Harry Reid will not strengthen the U.S.A. When it comes to the blame game, leftists can only lay it on G.W. Bush for so long. At some point you will have to accept that the solution has been worse than the problem and all hope is gone. I hope people come to their senses quickly and start to reverse the single party rule in the 2010 and 2012 elections. Hopefully the Republican leadership will have pulled their heads out of their collective a**es and returned to core values of smaller government, lower taxes, and fiscal responsibility. Both parties need to cooperate and come up with meaningful but not overbearing regulations to keep this kind of economic meltdown from happening again.

Broke Social security Gestapo=like department of Homeland security (in its structure, not its attitude... YET) and a welfare system that is used by the least qualified, while the most qualified are on the streets. Mr Obama is thrust into the fray and is swinging his sword in any way that can gain him an advantage i'll say this onthe record.: where as i do not agree with everything he is doing, he is, AT LEAST, thinking and plannin g. before implementing the plan he is putting it forth for review and tweaking. he is already 100% better thamn chenney and his puppet presidemnt, but then i think joe the plumber would have been a better choice for america than Bush

"social responsability" is not just about hard working people carrying the lazy. it is about the "lazier" people having the RESPONSABILITY of contributing to the table. i see a lot of accusations towards Mr O. about being a socialist, and yet our ENTIRE welfare system, our social security system and out police system are modeled after Marxist ideals. we all know where those led to. Broke Social security Gestapo=like department of Homeland security (in its structure, not its attitude... YET) and a welfare system that is used by the least qualified, while the most qualified are on the streets. Mr Obama is thrust into the fray and is swinging his sword in any way that can gain him an advantage i'll say this onthe record.: where as i do not agree with everything he is doing, he is, AT LEAST, thinking and plannin g. before implementing the plan he is putting it forth for review and tweaking. he is already 100% better thamn chenney and his puppet presidemnt, but then i think joe the plumber would have been a better choice for america than Bush Wow...are you miss guided....Marx, Gestapo and Hoover in one response....eeeeeekkk i figure if i have to be right, i might as well be EXTREMELY to the right... that way anyone to my left is WRONG!!
quote: Originally posted by 6486143: quote: Originally posted by Elesso: quote: Originally posted by M123Driver: While I agree with you Elesso that Mr. Obama was not responsible for the initial recession, he can be held accountable for the actions he and the Democrat controlled Congress have taken that are sure to turn a big problem into a catastrophe. He will be held accountable for increasing the deficit by obscene amounts that our grand children will still be paying into their retirement. He will be blamed for rushing this nation at breakneck speed into socialism by relieving people of what vestiges of personal responsibility remain and for the grand redistribution of wealth program he is implementing. People whine about outsourcing now; just wait until productive people get tired of carrying those who are not and leave the country for greener pastures or just decide wealth is not worth it since it is going to be seized anyway. There will be fewer and fewer "rich" people to support more and more underachievers. Coupled with socialized medicine, weakening our intelligence community and military, reduced individual and state rights and consolidation of power in the Federal Government these actions by Mr. Obama, Nancy Pelosi and Harry Reid will not strengthen the U.S.A. When it comes to the blame game, leftists can only lay it on G.W. Bush for so long. At some point you will have to accept that the solution has been worse than the problem and all hope is gone. I hope people come to their senses quickly and start to reverse the single party rule in the 2010 and 2012 elections. Hopefully the Republican leadership will have pulled their heads out of their collective a**es and returned to core values of smaller government, lower taxes, and fiscal responsibility. Both parties need to cooperate and come up with meaningful but not overbearing regulations to keep this kind of economic meltdown from happening again. content: I am sorry, even though I am not an Obama supporter, lol he hasn;t been in office long enough to have an Obamaville. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
